verses.roman:
āpana-mādhurye hare āpanāra mana
āpanā āpani cāhe karite āliṅgana

synonyms: āpana—own; mādhurye—by sweetness; hare—steals; āpanāra—His own; mana—mind; āpanā—Himself; āpani—He; cāhe—wants; karite—to do; āliṅgana—embracing.
translation: "Lord Kṛṣṇa's sweetness is so attractive that it steals away His own mind. Thus He even wants to embrace Himself.
